properties.name: Arnold Bay
properties.description: Posted by LetigreArnold Bay Road, Panton, Vermontskip stones here--or watch families launch small boats here or take their kids and dogs for a swim. beautiful and eery place where Benedict Arnold scuttled boats while pursued by British Navy during Revolutionary War

properties.name: Button Bay, where buttons are hard to come by these days
properties.description: Posted by LetigreButton Bay State Park, Vergennes VermontSmall state park. You can camp here at sites. but there is not much privacy if it is crowded. Great bay to wade around in. You can walk to the island closest to shore-fun thing to do and pretend you are a pirate, or some other far flung fantasy

properties.name: Daily Planet
properties.description: Posted by LetigreCenter Street, Burlington, VTby far the loveliest bar and most outstanding service in town. busy-funky-saucy, with noteworthy food and drink----------dim lighting

properties.name: Dirt Cowboy Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 7 S Main St, Hanover, NHFantastic coffee house. Great baked goods. Excellent coffee. Good vibe. \'Nuff said.

properties.name: Dog Tree
properties.description: Posted by LetigrePanton Road, Panton Vermontelm tree? tall-one of tallest trees in the area and it stands alone on side of incredibly straight and empty Panton Road--about 300 yards after passing over bridge of Dead Creek- When i was young, i called it the Dog Tree because I thought it resembled tree in book titled "GO DOG GO!" a bunch of dogs have a party in a huge tree...

properties.name: Eat Good Food
properties.description: Posted by Letigre Vergennes Vermontcolorful, vivacious, tasty food and decor. Main Street, Vergennes, Vermont

properties.name: First Seasons Greenhouses
properties.description: Posted by Letigre1900 Button Bay Road, Vergennes Vermontrundown, incredibly cheap and diverse plant selection, WHOLE GREENHOUSE OF STINKY MARIGOLDS! all run by eccentric old hermit a must see during travels to this area!

properties.name: THIRD BRIDGE
properties.description: Posted by LetigreSlang Road, Vergennes Vermontyou can spear carp here with pitchforks--- \'nough said

properties.name: first home in vermont
properties.description: Posted by LetigreStovepipe City Road, Vergennes, Vermontwell, this was a modest place. the upstairs bathroom had wallpaper that featured drawings of toilets throught the last 100 years. TACKY!
